alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Tippecanoe; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 15 at 10:15PM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Wildcat Creek near Lafayette affecting Tippecanoe County. Wabash River at Lafayette affecting Parke, Warren, Fountain, Tippecanoe and Vermillion Counties. .Rain, heavy at times, is expected to move into the region Wednesday evening, continuing through Thursday. Total rainfall accumulation of 2 to 3 inches is expected, leading to moderate flooding along points of the Upper Wabash River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Lafayette. * WHEN...From Thursday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Extensive flooding blocks access to River Bend Hospital by North River Road. Shamrock Park and the old Municipal Golf Course are extensively flooded. Residents along North River Rd, Davis Ferry Rd area and Barton Beach Road area are impacted by flood waters. In Tippecanoe County Barton Beach Rd, SR 225, CR 950 W and portions of Division and CR 700 W are flooded near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Thursday morning and continue rising to a crest of 20.8 feet early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Wednesday morning by around 1100 AM EST.
